item.description:
Four pizzerias, four city districts and four groups of starving customers… It is here, where Gill Bates created his Micropizzas while listening to Jack Michaelson singing “Eat it”. It is also here where the world-famous scientist, Stevie Falconing, is looking for holes in dough and Beat Oven composed his Grosse Funghi…

Pizza Wars PL is a hilarious game for both children and adults in which you take over as an owner of one of four pizzerias and you compete with others, trying to pay the credit off, taken to set up your business. With every baked pizza, you are one step closer to achieve your target..!
Will you meet all your customers’ needs or will you rather meet… a debt collector..?

In Pizza Wars PL, you run a pizzeria in one of four districts of the city Margherita. These are: 

 business district,
 bohemian, 
 villa 
 district of poverty. 




There are 15 unique customers (customer cards) originating from each of them (a total of 60). Each player starts with a different game board and some money.
As an owner of the premises in a given social background you possess a special feature (fixed bonus) helping you to serve guests from your neighbourhood. During the game you can also acquire an extra piece of equipment:

 fridge 
 oven
 trolley
 table
 “connections” 




These increases your chance of victory and modify the strategy.

Each customer requires a pizza with particular ingredients that you have to acquire to bake (cards of ingredients). You may buy them from the market place (on display) or draw randomly for free from the deck. After each round the market place changes (ingredients rot).

There are as many turns as players and within your turn there are also two phases: 

 you may either collect new ingredients or bake a pizza, 
 pay your credit off (move on the board) or acquire a piece of equipment.




You can have a maximum of 2 customers and 6 ingredients (some bonuses can change this rule) on hand.

Having baked a pizza, your customer pays you some money, one’s card is discarded and you compulsorily draw a new customer – you may decide if you want one from your own district or from the common deck. The money you earn has to be spent on new ingredients and on a rate of the credit. The player who pays the credit off as first, wins the game.

There is an extra set of easier rules for younger children.

item.description:
An auction game based on the tv series of the same name. You bid on a number of real-life objects (each on a card), hopefully buying things much cheaper than the amount hidden on the cards.

The game ends when one player has won five auctions or purchased stuff for DKK 999,900.

Fate of Akalon: Tribes is a 2-4 player combat card game set on the dying continent of Akalon. Players control a tribe of fantasy races in a struggle for survival. Each turn a player will play a card to the battlefield and compare combat values. The winner's card goes to their discard pile, the loser's card to that players cemetery. The winner is the first player to send 30 points worth of combat value to their opponent's cemetery. Each race's deck contains unique thematic powers to influence the combat values when played.

Fate of Akalon: Tribes is a quick, thematic card game that surprises with depth of play belying its simple mechanisms.

item.description:
All Gods Are Dying is a strategic board game about the true nature of religions

Earth is the planet of our evolution. The home of all mankind and all of it’s imaginary creations, the so called „Gods”. These things can elicit such emotions in humans that make them able to willingly do literally anything. Churches are organizations created to control and use these emotions. They nourish the delusion and work for their owners’ greed. Atheists are free fighters against Gods.

Every player leads a religion. Religion deceives with light but good things are all available by secular ways. Delusion, oppression flow from religion. Missionaries collect money and convert people. The aim is to make more money, to level-up the religion, to reach the highest level and power over all others.

There are three different kind of areas in the game where religion’s missionaries can get money from believers. City, country, and playground - because some religions like to use children for their purposes. Values are depending on the religion’s nature and popularity in the area.

You start the game on the first level. By collecting enough money you level-up your religion in greed. By successfully finishing a mission you level-up your religion in spirituality. On player's board numbers show bonus points or penalties valid at that level. That value influences the collected money and the power to convert as well.

Four kinds of levels are to go through from white to red. With different colors new action cards and mission cards become available. Level-up by money becomes more expensive. You have five cards in the game, action and mission cards mixed. You have three cards hidden with face down. And you have to show openly the other two.

You may do the following in your turn:

 Roll the dice and move your followers (the pieces)
 Get your money from your followers
 Or convert other player’s follower
 Use an action card and draw another one – action or mission card
 And may accomplish one of your missions




Or, if you don’t like your cards

 You may replace up to three of them.




Your aims are

 to reach the top level of greed,
 to reach the top level of spirituality.




Depending on the game style you may win by reaching the top level, or beating others.

Pocket and Biscuit is a game of collecting delicious cookies. Tiles are laid face down (pocket showing) in a 6x6 grid, and players must find the cookies they want to eat. If you start by finding a single cookie, then two, then even three or more, your cookies can add up, but you always have to put something back in your pocket for later.

Players take turns finding cookies until someone's pockets are full, at which point the person with the most cookies wins.

What if the power to grant life was used on the best parts of the world’s most infamous monsters? What if you knew this secret? Would you make the world a better place, or just a better place … for you?

Dicenstein lets you dig up body parts, use them to build a monster, then use that monster to attack your rivals’ monsters, all the while assembling a monster army for world domination. It features heaps of dice rolling and constant decision-making to better your monster and your parts collection. You have to balance creating your monster army (which means spending body parts) with creating the best monster possible (which means hoarding monster parts).

The monsters are constructed by rolling monster part dice and assembling them onto a slab in your lab. Each monster has its own unique ability - combine multiple monsters to get more abilities!

item.description:
This is a game full of humoristic streaks, Norwegian myths, sensations and celebrities.

In Norsk Galskp (=Norwegian Madness) you win if you are the first player to travel from start through to finish, but on the way you have to do funny tasks that will bring out your true inner madness.In this game you can get the ability to send your opponents into a 4 second slow motion state, draw cards to make the others pick invisible apples from the ceiling every time you shout "apple-picking", or maybe you are the one who has to improvise a "Joik"(=Sami song) whilst the other players clap a beat?

If you bring Norsk Galskap to the check-out till, you're not just buying a game, but moments filled with both madness and laughter. Norsk Galskap takes but 20 seconds to learn, and will make holidays, cabin-trips and Friday nights into stories and events that might never be forgotten.
Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach space 28 wins the game. By the roll of an even number, the player moves forward. If the player rolls an odd number, he has to move backward.

Centerville is a relatively light board game for 2-4 players. Centerville abstractly models the growth and management of a small city — perhaps not unlike the one you're in right now.

Players act as entrepreneurs, tycoons, politicians, and other local movers and shakers working to develop a modern urban area. Fortunes will be made and fame will rise. As time goes by, personal milestones will enrich the players even further.

Throughout the game, players will roll six dice, keeping some and rerolling others, then implementing the various die faces on the game board. This will result in political offices being gained and lost, new vocations learned, new land acquired, or new buildings constructed. The end result is a vibrant community revered near and wide — but only the player who has best balanced their wealth and prestige will emerge the final victor.

Playing time is 15-20 minutes per player.

item.description:
GNIAC is a party game that includes Creative Contests, Team Challenges, and Games of Skill. There are 30 games inside the can, and a spinner underneath the lid.

To play, you spread the cards out, grab some pens and paper, and hit the spinner to find your first host. That person chooses a card, reads the game out loud, then hosts that game. If it's a creative game, that host is also the judge. Play 6-8 games in a night, and whoever has the most points is the winner.

Games include composing new national anthems for different countries, banking paper balls off your teammate's forehead into the can, launching paper airplanes, creating new animals for Noah's Ark 2.0, presenting new business ideas, and a lot more.

It's a deduction game in which each player takes a secret role.
There is a big variation of roles with different abilities, but the essential ones are the murderers, their spy, the cup and the victims.

The game starts and the cup knows one murderer and the spy. Each day after discussion players vote to lynch one player, who is eliminated without making known his identity, and without participating for the rest of the game. After the day, during the night murderers show to the already eliminated players, who they are killing.

Game ends if all murderers are killed, or if the number of murderers is the same with all the 'good' players.

Shadows in the Weald introduces the Heroes & Hirelings system of fantasy skirmish combat games. Each player controls a Party comprised of two kinds of Characters: Heroes and, you guessed it, Hirelings. Heroes are powerful, named Characters with special abilities. Hirelings are anonymous mooks who give adjacent Characters the benefits (and detriments) of Buffs.

Shadows in the Weald is a fast-paced crazy-action square-and-counter extravaganza with bells on. The game comes with eight different Heroes, eight different types of Hirelings, several Magic Items, and five scenarios. It debuts in the fifth issue of Yaah! magazine.

Biergarten is designed to be a quick game for a relaxing afternoon with friends, and features 64 individually designed cards with Alpine-inspired architecture and decor.

Biergarten is essentially a tile placement game, and players compete as up-and-coming restaurant owners expanding their outdoor patios, or biergartens. Each card features either one or two colors, as well as a wall segment on one, two, or three sides of the card. Players earn points for each color match that they make, and having a match between each of the four colors earns a bonus of three points. Watch out for walls -- they block the flow of the garden, and color matches can't be made through a wall. However, if players can entirely enclose their biergarten within a continuous wall, they earn a six point bonus.

The first player to fifteen points triggers the victory round, with each player thereafter getting one additional turn to top the winning point value.

The World's Fair of 1893 in Chicago was a spectacular international exhibition that showcased many great achievements in science, technology, culture, and entertainment. Acting as organizers of the fair, players work diligently to increase their influence throughout the fair and obtain the grand exhibits that will be put on display. The organizer who has earned the best reputation when the fair begins will emerge the victor.

On each turn of World's Fair 1893, the active player sends a supporter to one of the five areas and gather all of the cards by it. New cards are then added to some of the areas, and the next player takes a turn.

The five areas represent sections of exhibits, like Fine Arts and Electricity. Some cards represent exhibit proposals in one of those five areas, others represent influential people who give you bonus supporters, and other cards represent tickets for attractions and concessions along the Midway.

The game consists of three scoring rounds, each triggered when players collectively gather a certain number of Midway tickets. Players gain reputation points for leading in number of supporters in an area and for gathering the most tickets in each round. The leaders in an area also receive approval for exhibit proposals they have gathered that match the area. Players gain reputation points at the end of the game based on the breadth and diversity of their approved exhibits.

item.description:
Corrotto is a crime/politics themed market game played with a standard deck of cards. Separate the deck into 3 decks, the draw deck A/2/3/4, the Market Deck 5/6/7/8/9 and the board set up 10/Jokers/J/Q/K. Set up all KQJ10s in four rows of same suits placing Jokers on the tens and randomly draw four face up cards from the market deck below the tens. KQs are the Royal Council and the Jacks separate the council from the marketplace. The draw deck is where you legally earn money by drawing cards, the market deck gets drawn into the marketplace when cards are reserved or purchased. Purchase cards with cards of the same color.

When cards are discarded or spent they go face up into the appropriate decks discard section where market cards become the black market and draw cards become heists. To do illegal actions such as purchasing from the Black Market or perform a heist you must bribe a face card by placing a card higher than previous card of the same suit on the card taking lower bribe into your hand. Anyone can bribe a Jack but you must pay off a Royal for there loyalty. Pay off Queens first which cost 25 Of its suit minus the Jack bribe, same for king but also minus the Queen bribe, place a player marker on Royal. Royal bribes are always scored as end points but the game ends and scores differently in ways of play.

There are 3 different variants of Corrotto: Ladies First, Hot Potato and Rat Race.

Players secretly get 8 cards of destinations. On a map of Switzerland, they move their pawn according to a special dice showing 3 different dots and a question mark. If they roll a dot, they are entitled to move to the next space showing the same dot. Question mark means draw a card and follow the instructions. If you reach a space requested by one of your destination cards, you receive the mentioned number of adventure points. The player who visited first all 8 destinations receives another 5 points. Player with the most points wins.

New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition, players do not play in teams anymore, but try to get as many points for only themselves. The cards show 4 different words, as well as the way you need to explain them (verbally, pantomimic, by drawing). The rules are slightly changed so that it works without teams. Points are given to the player who guesses right and the player who acted, described or drew the words.

item.description:
Launch your fleet, capture ports, and wage war in the absolutely epic board game for 2-5 players. In Empires at Sea, you play as one of five nations, and work to amass the largest empire at the end of 15 rounds of play.

A Quick Overview of the Game

Each Round opens with a History Card, which hurts or helps one nation or another based on the actual impact of the actual historical event. A Weather Card is played, limiting or improving movement for all players for the Round (e.g., ships can only move North and East). Next, all players gain resources, based on the Ports they own, plus any Resource Cards played during the game.

Each player then takes a turn, first by playing a Captain's Card (used to launch a ship, advance your military, strengthen a port, etc) and then by sailing their fleet to take command of new ports, trade, or attack their enemies. The combat system is based on a roll of the dice, plus modifiers for ship size, the weather gauge, military advancements, and Captain's Orders.

At the end of the round, all players may bribe the Pirate. The highest bidder gets to use this ship to attack their friends/enemies/loved-ones.

At the end of the game, you tally up your Empire score based on the ships you sink, the ships you command, the ports you own, and the gold and resources you've collected. The biggest Empire wins.

item.description:
"Sjansen" is a Dutch word for flirting. It's a tongue in cheek game about flirting.

From the publisher's website:
In the bar, at courtside or in class rooms: flirting is possible everywhere. Nevertheless one is better at it than the other. Fortunately a game exists that teaches you flirting in three simple lessons. Decide how far you will go and with whom.

It's a matter of luck, an enormous challenge, but above all it's a tactical game. Newbies need practise, others are naturals. Anyway every single student needs to do it often. Everyone gets the same lessons but not everyone will learn as fast. Mixed signals, it's all there. Take your chance and maybe you will find Mr. or Mrs. Right this way!

Waka Tanka is a very light bluffing card game in the Bullshit family. Players are Native American shamans who want to impress the tribe by conjuring various animal spirits and having long discussions with them. The problem is that the shaman doesn't always remember the right incantation and somewhat calls the wrong spirit — hoping no one will notice.

Each player in turn plays an incantation card face down in front of an animal totem. Other players can call the bluff if they think it's not the right animal. A player can also try a full ceremony if he thinks enough incantations have been made to a given animal spirit. A player wins by getting rid of all their incantation cards or fulfilling two ceremonies.

item.description:
Translated from the back of the box:

Find the key hidden inside the caverns and free the knights from the claws of the dragon Gorgotte.

Answering questions will help you discover the hidden caches in the caves.

Use your weapons to combat the monsters and avoid being captured by the Dragon Gorgotte.

Find the keys and free your companion knights and win the game.

Mont a Mots Gorgotte was created with a simple idea in mind: Help young children in the first cycle of education to learn French in an original and playful way. Based on tested tools and expert teachers the family game Mont a Mots is designed to help your children. Offer your child Mont a Mots, a most entertaining tool to assist in the development of your child.

Basically you are a knight battling monsters while traveling around the game board. Caves along the way contain power ups (weapons and healing items) to assist you in your battles. However to obtain them, you must answer questions on cards. These questions are designed to improve your ability to speak and understand French.

The game comes with the box, instructions, game board, 275 questions, 5 cardboard knights, 5 pawn holders, 39 cardboard tokens and one d6.

Unite with Earth's Mightiest heroes in this Avengers edition of Uno Game!

Fight the foes no single hero could withstand with the special Avengers Assemble card!

And remember to yell "Uno!" before you play your last card and the battle is won!

Contents: 112 cards, instructions. includes 4 special Avengers Assemble cards with a special rule:

Whenever evil dares to show its face, the Avengers assemble to defeat it! When another player plays a Draw 2 or a Draw 4 card on you, you may use this card to block it! This card is also a wild card, so you choose the color that resumes play.
In Knight-mare Chess each player controls their troops with their knights and the shaman. Players should move their pieces and destroy their opponents with strategy and luck.

item.description:
First Century B.C., Julius Caesar advances - unrelenting - with his legions.
The Romans are now close to the heart of the Celtic lands, where the ancient traditions are still alive and instill courage and determination for the last stand against such a mighty enemy...

It is the night of Samhain, the most sacred night of the year. Celtic tribes gather to ask the ancient Gods for help. This time they will ask not only for the strength to sustain themselves, but also for the courage to fight the invaders and - most importantly - for the name of the one that shall lead them to war.

Samhain is a game for 2-4 players that lasts about 60 minutes.

In Samhain, you will need to manage your clan the best you can, placing your clan members on the village locations each turn and performing the most suitable actions for your strategy. You must obtain resources and manage them properly in order to expand your clan and mess with your opponents!

Each player will be the chief of a clan who will try to become the most powerful one in order to be placed in charge of the resistance against the Romans. Your clan members must be divided between locations in the village, performing actions, and those who are praying in the temples dedicated to their Gods. The locations will grant you instant advantages, but the temples will grant the power necessary to expand your clan and to lead it toward the glory.

The Romans must not be underestimated. Before invading the lands of the Celts, they will try to poison the hearts of the tribes, in order to corrupt the clans and to use them for their own purpose.

item.description:
Stack 'Em 5 is a highly addictive, unique new board game that has aspects of several classics before it, such as chess, checkers, tic-tac-toe, Connect 4, Go, and even Pente, but on a whole new level, or should I say levels. Think of it as 3D connect 5 on gogo juice! And, unlike all its predecessors, and most strategy games of today, Stack'Em 5 allows for more than 2 players at a time. That being said, it is an incredibly strategic battle for 2 players, however as many as 7 can enjoy it, but with 8 or more we wont take responsibility for what might happen next. You and your family & friends will find a new meaning of competitiveness, making Monopoly Night look like a calm night! It's extremely simple to learn for even the youngest gamer, but will take years to master its strategies, making it challenging for the veteran player as well.

Strategy 101: Every single move counts in the which players try to achieve 5 in-a-row, ball by ball! The fundamental rules take less than a minute to learn, yet the game has the complexity to engage both beginners and experts alike - perfect for the entire family!

Stack 'Em 5 Rules!

Each player chooses a color and takes a set of balls. Players take turns stacking balls on the board, the first player starts by placing his/her first ball within the 9 center rods, after which point play is open to any of the 49 rods. Each and every ball is stacked strategically so that 5-in-a-row is accomplished vertically, horizontally, or diagonally just so long as it forms a straight line from point to point with NO turns. Easy Right! The rotation of play is counter-clockwise with a time limit of 30 seconds per turn, keeping you on your toes. The board itself spins completely around, either left or right on the center rod, giving the current player the ability to look at all the different angles. Only the current player may move the board, and he/she may do so as mush as they like, until the end of their turn. Once a ball is stacked, it cannot be removed or placed elsewhere, and the players turn is over. There are no restrictions on how balls of different colors are stacked. You may put a ball on any of the 49 rods that are open. Once 7 balls occupy a rod, that rod is full, giving the players a total of 343 possible positions on the board. The goal is to simply block your opponent from getting 5-in-a-row while strategically placing your balls to do just that. Be tactical. Obstruct your opponent(s) while expanding your own “territory”. The game ends when a player has been able to link 5-in-a-row in any way possible.

Pour It To 'Em Boys is an accurate fast play rule set for the American Civil War. It is designed for an evening's fun with a few figures or for a large battle with no paperwork. As written the rules are for 15mm, 20mm, and 25mm models. For 5mm to 10mm substitute centimeters for inches. The rules are written for reasonable people. If there is a disagreement during a game each player rolls 2 dice and the high scorer makes his/her point.

Originally published without copyright.

These rules were previously published as a broader period rules set titled "Kepi & Pickelhaube".

A family board game for pirates
Backgammon style roll and move.
Collecting gold and item cards 
Trying to collect a set and get all your counter off the board.

This memory game contains 12 sets of puzzles and their respective puzzle boards, which are used to play a number of competitive or cooperative games within the predetermined time limits.

For example, when playing a competitive game, each player chooses a set of puzzles and places its pieces in the center of the playing surface face down, together with other players’ puzzle pieces.

All players take turns pointing to a missing piece on their own puzzle boards and turning over a puzzle piece to see if there is a match. Before passing the turn to the next player, any matching puzzle piece is placed on the corresponding puzzle board, while a mismatched puzzle piece is turned to face down again in the center of the playing surface.

The goal of this game is to be the first player to complete his/her puzzle board.

A version of Cat and Chocolate with everyday scenarios. Each turn, the active player draws an event card depicting a certain crisis they must handle - being chased by bees! Bad breath! Or a long line for the bathroom! The player then chooses one to three item cards from their hand and explains how they use these items to get out of the situation.

Other players then vote on whether or not the active player succeeds; if a majority of players agree, the player keeps the event card. At the beginning of the game, players are secretly divided between Team Cat and Team Chocolate. The game is over when a special "End!" event card is drawn, at which point players reveal their team allegiance and count up the number of event cards they've won for their side. The team with the most event cards is the winner!

Players play Vikings chieftains, seeking to develop their own territory.

Each player uses his own deck of cards (preconstructed or drafted). The deck includes Location, Unit and Treasure cards. Location and Unit cards are placed in the territory when played. Treasure cards provide an immediate effect and are then discarded.

Common Location cards are placed in the center of the table and 
can be used by all players. Unit cards can use them to collect resources, become first player, gain Victory Points, launch Expeditions agains the other players, ...

At the beginning, the players only have their Patriarch. By expanding their territory with Location and Unit cards, they will be able to perform more actions. Playing cards and restoring Units requires resources and these are scarce as players compete for them.

At the end of the game, players tally their points: VP gained during the game plus 1 or 2 VP per card in their territory (2 if the Patriarch became King).

The player who won the most Victory Points wins the game.

The game box provides all components to play a 2 to 4-player game. It contains 20 rare cards out of 40.
Booster packs sold separately provide 16 common cards and 5 rare cards.

The party game with movies you joke about making with friends.

Its an adult themed party game where you get to pick the star and the category for the movie you are developing for the round. But your plot is entirely luck of the draw meaning its picked at random and it can make or break your movie. The judge of the round picks the movie they would most be willing to see... or the best sold. Which-ever way they choose, the first to 3 or 6 - three card combos, wins.

The box contains 300 cards. 100 stars, 100 categories, 100 plots. Players use a hand of 4 stars and 4 categories, choosing 1 of each for their round (unless they have a card that says different.

item.description:
Battle Axe is a simple diceless tabletop system for skirmish-level battles in the fantasy genre. It uses a card-based system that offers a wealth of options in game-play and allows players the experience of seeing their tactical decisions win the day, rather than the luck of the dice. By combining the best that CCG and tabletop gaming have to offer you end up with a system that offers endless options and expansion.

The rules and cards provided in the Deluxe Set will be enough to get you started, and new characters and rule expansions are available to increase both the size and composition of your War Bands.

A card game, set in the Iron Age and created in Italy to be used in school, right after the lessons about the Iron Age (Secolo di Ferro).

Its 150 cards depict seven different cultures: Catholics, Protestants, Scientists, Demoniacs, Pirates, Turks and Artists.

Card types span from figures (Protagonists and Characters) to Strongholds, Objects and Specials. 31 Attack cards are provided to weaken the enemy cities.

To win, you have to create a city containing figures from at least five cultures.

Played in the classroom, the game entertains the children while helping them remember some key concepts about the Iron Age.

How great are your Guestimates?

The question master reads the question, all the other players agree on a guestimate. The question master has three shouts: 'more', 'less', or 'exact' … Size matters!

Children are introduced to their first English words by seeing, hearing, and speaking them. Included are a pair matching game and a bingo game. Early exposure to a foreign language promotes children's communication skills and strengthens their self confidence.

A family friendly abstract strategy game designed for two or four players played on a multi colored checkered board.

The object of the game is to score as many points as possible by moving both your own pieces and those of your opponents off your colored edge of the board.

This is accomplished by rolling the die and deciding whether to choose to place a new piece on the board, move one of your own playable pieces, or move an opponent's piece that is currently located on your colored half of the board.

At the end of the game, players tally the points in their booty bags and the player with the highest point total is the winner.

item.description: The game contains 140 questions, which can be answered by the players. It also contains 10 activity cards with a variety of tasks to be carried out. It basically works like a travel edition of the game Trivial Pursuit.

Welcome to a land where creation is but a simple step away from ingenuity plus a few simple resources imbued with ancient alchemy - this is Alkemia. Prepare to harness the primal art of alchemy and to join the ranks of creators who have been shaping and reforming the raw land of Alkemia into a thriving livelihood centered on a grand city of alchemy deemed Crasis. Governed by a circle of seers and a single Grand Alchemist, who wields boundless talent and protects the ancient secrets of the Greater Elemental Spirits, Crasis now seeks its next Grand Alchemist, who will be one of the few alchemists attempting to prove their abilities by synthesizing the legendary Crest of Creation. This crest, a fabled mysticism documented to usher the golden age of alchemy and balance, can only be crafted by one skilled alchemist able to harness the five elements of earth, fire, water, air, and ether, using both natural and manufactured resources.

Take to the urban bazaars and elemental wilds of a land that is enriched by the power of alchemy blessed by the elements. Players can look forward to managing organic resources as one of six characters to craft powerful items in a race to become the Grand Alchemist. First, harvest the Foraging Fields to gather your base reagents and collect recipes used to craft items; then, alchemists will combine their base reagents to synthesize items from their recipes – all with usable effects aimed to both assist the creator and hinder competitors. 
 Players will ultimately quell everything at their disposal to create their own legendary Crest of Creation via a randomly generated recipe gained through playing, which will lead the most skilled alchemist to victory. Do you have what it takes to be worthy of the Crest of Creation? Be prepared, for Destiny’s recipe calls for you

item.description:
Side Quest is a dungeon crawling card game that fits in your pocket. With a single deck of cards and a couple of dice you and up to 3 friends can battle your way through a decision-packed dungeon. Fight monsters, grab loot and rescue maidens as you gear up your characters to fight the boss at the end of the dungeon.

Side Quest is a fully co-operative game - if any Heroes (or maidens!) die, the game is lost.

There are a wide range of scenarios to play, including ultra-tough single-player missions, challenging 30 minute pick-up games and lengthy 2 hour dungeon treks. With loads of different Heroes, Monsters and Equipment cards you'll never play the same game twice.

Plan together, fight together, win together!

name.value: Heroes of Troy: A Game of the Trojan War for One to Two Players.

item.description:
INTRODUCTION: Heroes of Troy is a Game set during the Trojan War, according to Homer’s ‘The Iliad’. The game focuses on the man-to-man combat that is so prevalent throughout The Iliad. Players will assume the role of a Commander of either the Achaean (Greek) or Trojan Armies during the Trojan War.

OBJECTIVE: The First player to capture at least two of the three Rear Sectors of their Opponent wins the Game. Alternatively, the Player who scores the most Victory Points (VP) for slaying opposing Warriors during the Turn in which the last Fate Card is Drawn, wins.

"3 designers, 6 games, 15 dice."

6 is a collaboration between three game designers to provide a collection of light dice games. The tin contains a collection of dice and rules for six games that can be played with them. The games are:

Airstrike: Drop dice sequentially onto the table to obtain a combination of values positions that ensures your bombers make it home.

Dicey Winks: A dexterity game about launching dice from the '6' tin to land your dice near to a target while displacing your opponent's dice.

Foiled: A dueling simulation and bluffing game about selecting the right dice and maneuvers to strike your opponent to push them off the piste.

Slipstream: A risk management racing game, in which turn order is determined by current score.

Triangles: A bidding game in which you must spot and exploit the highest value triangle that you can land your scoring die inside.

Wrestle: Establish the best hold to limit your opponents opportunities to escape it before running out of strength.

In Conservation Crisis you set out to save your chosen species from extinction. You do this by acquiring resources for your reserve and creating environments where the animals can survive alongside the local communities. Its design combines the experiences Richard has had through his conservation work and our combined love of board games.

Conservation Crisis has been designed with education and family fun in mind. Several complex and conflicting real world decisions are simplified into the game mechanics. However players should understand that conservation is never simple neither in the game or in real life.

One-third of profits from the sale of the board game ‘Conservation Crisis’ together with all donations received from play-testing ‘Conservation Crisis’ via the Tunza Games website will be shared between the David Shepherd Wildlife Foundation (Registered Charity No. 1106893) and up to two other charitable foundations working to protect wildlife.

The card passing, hand trading game of playing matchmaker in 1940’s New York. Great for 1 – 10 players, taking about 10 minutes per game. Hot Pursuit uses 3 cards per player and only needs your hands. New cards aren’t drawn or played – no table needed!

A modern man, done with his day’s work, steps out of his office tower’s lobby into the busy bustle of a city sidewalk. Just as he is getting his bearings set towards home, he collides with someone. He apologizes profusely. She politely excuses herself. He tries to ask if she’s alright but she just scurries off again. Who was that lovely lady and why was she in such a hurry? Now, it’s time for you to be a true friend and help this modern man find his missing beauty.

GAMEPLAY: 3 cards are dealt to each player. Whomever is dealt the Pink card becomes the Jealous Ex bent on sabotaging the game, the person who receives the Blue card is the Modern Man, and everyone else is a friend. All of the friendly players earn a joint victory by passing and trading until the Pink and Blue cards are both in the Modern Man's hand, facing him. However, the Jealous Ex wins if he/she can manipulate the Pink and Blue cards together, facing anyone who is not the Modern Man. ***Extra rules and story for solitaire, 2 players, and team play with player elimination, included!

item.description:
For a long time ago,three witches duel each other for that get the epic magical relic called "Tetrite".
They must draw magical power form 3 tetrite, and cast their spells for beat their opponent.
It depends on your choice which witch will can survive?

TetrAction is a game of Three-dimensional puzzle for 2 players.
Your goal is to beat your opponent that you must decrease opponent's life 15 to 0.

The feature of this game is 3 tetrahedrons.They have 3 colors: red,blue,and yellow.Their surface have one of them.
On the board and your hand(reveal) have some magic scroll.
It have cost that 3 colors and sequences.

[example1] R:Red B:Blue Y:Yellow X:any color
If the cost is "RRRXX" 3 surface in your view must be RRRXX.

item.description:
Strategie Game/Placement Game for two people:

The winner is the first person who can place a pyramid, a strip or a group of stars with his own blocks. In most cases the game is then finished.

Contains 36 triangles in red and blue, 3 sets of each pieces each numbered from 1-6

General Rules:

 An enclosed empty space may never be formed on the playing field.
 Each block must be placed so as to be touching at least one other block on at least one side.
 Star:




6 blocks of the same colour placed together in a hexagon form a star; complete stars (including those which extend into other stars) are only protected against the moves of an opponent, not against the player's own moves.

Course of the Game:
The players decide who shall start. Every player places one block of his colour. All of the blocks must be placed in the playing field before the first player begins moving or exchanging blocks. Only one block can be moved or two blocks exchanged per turn.

Moving:
A player can only move his/her own blocks at random to a new position in the playing field.

Exchanging:
The positions of two blocks may be interchanged in an exchange. A player's own blocks rnay be exchanged regardless of the numbering. A player's blocks rnay only be exchanged with those of an opponent when the numbers of both blocks are the sarne, i.e., 4 for 4.

Formations:

Pyramid:
The placing together of 16 blocks of the same colour in an equal-sided triangle.

Strip:
11 blocks of the same colour in a straight line.

Star group:
Four stars of the same colour extending into one another and containing 16-18 blocks (depending on the form of the group) make up a star group.

Card Game
Object of the game: To get as many high scoring pairs as possible.
The winner: is the one with the highest score. This is determined by adding up the numbers on the right hand corner of each pair of mates.
 Dealer gives each player seven cards and puts the rest of the pack in the middle, turning over the first card. Each player looks to see if he has any mates. This can be seen by matching the number at the top right hand corner. A pair must be one male and one female, not two males or females. If he has any pairs, he places them face up in front of him, so that everyone can see.
Each turn, the player must have a minimum of five cards in his hand before he starts. If his hand has become depleted because he won some pairs on his previous turn, then he must take as many cards as he needs from the middle pile to bring his hand up to five. He can take the last card thrown down by the last player as one of these cards if he wishes. If he has a pair (or pairs), he puts them in front as before so that everyone can see. At the end of his turn, he throws down one card on the upturned pile.
Tracey Trouble card can be acted upon when the player wishes to steal unprotected pairs ie: if one is picked from the pile, he may act upon it immediately or keep it until it is of more use.
Johnny Condom cards can be used whenever a player wants to protect his pairs whether he picks one up or is dealt one. To protect a pair he must place a Johnny Condom card on top of that pair.
Right Brian Bummer cards are good for nothing and are there as a joker card - mainly to hold up the game.
5When all the pairs are out and the only cards still circulating are Tracey’s, Johnny’s or Right Brian’s, then each player adds up his score and the player with the highest number is the winner.

Amusing Note: According to the back of the box there are cards called 'Right Brain Bummer', i.e. no good, but in the components they have changed to 'Right Brian Bummer'. Someone didn't do their spell-checking very well.

A 3-in-1 in which you try to predict the Outcome of the Batter at Bat. The 3 ways are:"LIVE" Batter a Batter; from a Custom Deck of 52-Cards; a Batter from a custom 12-Sided Dice;
Using an 8-card "Master 8" deck, you choose a card that you predict will be the outcome.
The 3 versions of the game each have a different "Outcome":
"LIVE" Interactive version - Predict Outcome of Batter at bat in a live game.
"TABLE" Custom 52-Card Deck version - Predict Outcome of next card to be turned over.
"DICE" Custom 12-Sided Dice version - Predict Outcome of next roll of single 12-sided dice.
Score is kept track with "Game Tokens". Each Player starts with 15-20 (Depending upon Game Set). For each "At Bat", Players put token in and pick a Master 8 card. The Player with the most Game Tokens at the end of the game is the winner!

In Bountytown, from Victoria Van Winkle and Michael Huven-Moore, three to six players take on the roles of unique characters in the Wild West, dueling bounties and each other in a race to build up the most Renown in Bountytown. Players move around the town, activating unique locations to gain advantages and to shore up weaknesses. The bounty hunter who has earned the most Renown when the dust settles wins the game!

item.description: Discover the CHOUFFE world. Build La Chouffe icons out of bricks in a certain time.

Norrköping is a game intended to promote the eponymous city and its businesses. Mechanically it is a close Monopoly clone, where you move across the board, purchases pieces of property, build on them and hope to have your opponents land on them and go bankrupt. There is also a variant which distributes a few starting properties and shortens the game overall.

In GameFactory, players lead successful computer game companies that try to create the next big hit. They must build rooms in their offices, hire staff and decide which project will be the next one to bring to market.

GameFactory is a worker placement game with a twist: players start with a small office and only a few options for their workers. They use funds to build new rooms with new capabilities and add them to their office, enabling new placement positions and new options. Players then use staff to build games or spend their work on creating other useful things that help them becoming the next computer game legend.

Game Factory is a game for gamers with over 150 cards, a market board, 45 wooden pieces and more than 100 cardboard markers. Two to four players compete in 90-120 minutes about who wins the most cash in the ever-changing computer gaming market.

Board Game based on the events of Quackscam, a 1980 wildlife/poaching raid in Beardstown, Illinois.

A simple roll and move game. Players roll 1 die and move along the hunting path the number of spaces rolled. Spaces along path have you draw Violation/Lucky cards or take various other actions.

From the manual:

"The game of Quackscam is played along a "hunting path" consisting of 96 spaces. It is designed for 2, 3, or 4 players. The game includes the following items:

1 Quackscam playing board
54 Violation cards
20 Lucky cards
4 plastic markers (or tokens)
2 Dice

The object of the game is to get to the end of the hunting path as quickly as you can with as many high point violation cards as possible. Each violation card has a point value.

After all players have finished the "hunt", each player adds up the total points of all his violation cards. The player with the most total points wins the game."

The Dutch Blitz Blue Expansion Pack can be used together with regular Dutch Blitz in order to enable games with 5-8 players.

Contains: 160 cards

Publisher description:

Dutch Blitz has developed this expansion that allows you to play with up to eight players. Insane!

And, here's the thing. You can play with this New Blue pack, just like Classic Green, with up to 4 players OR combine the two packs to play with 5, 6, 7 or 8 players. Outta control!

So, what makes New Blue different? It's simply a reinvention of the Classic Green boxed game that you know and love, with the colours of the four decks' designs (carriage, bucket, pump and plow) switched to enable more players. Yes, it's that simple and that awesome.

item.description:
Theme:

Yokai Battle originates from the Japanese occult monster realm. A yokai is a creature that has been made real by our fears or beliefs. In ancient times, while the yokai were conquering the world, a few men decided to resist them, training themselves to be Shamans. In Yokai Battle, you will become one of them, battling in today’s world.

Gameplay:

Yokai Battle is 2 - 4 players tactical card game.

Goal:

The players have to conquer 5 terrain tiles by summoning 5 of their monsters onto them.

item.description:
Light Bobs was the nickname for the British light infantry, first used during the American Wars of Independence, and later commonly applied to the Light Division during the Napoleonic wars.

Light Bobs is meant to cover actions where hundreds, rather than thousands, of soldiers are deployed. Light Bobs is written at battalion level where the player commands four or more units called Companies. Companies are small (4 to 12 figures). This scale is larger than a man-to-man encounter, but below a brigade or multiple battalion engagement.

A basic game is between two leaders called Leaders of Worth with each commanding 4 to 6 Companies. Action is fast and sharp with the different Companies being of mixed arms and varying moral types. This is the scale of small units led by individual officers. To bring out the individuality of the scale and the period personality rules are used from which allow players to watch their Leader of Worth grow as a commander as they go from battle to battle. This system is a sort of paperless campaign.

Art Dealer is a game about buying and selling of fine-art paintings, including Picasso's, Rembrandt's, and Carravagio's.

Players can buy paintings from six galleries, specialising in Landscape, Portrait, History, Genre, Still-life, and Animal paintings.

They can then sell these paintings at a profit (and an increase in reputation as an Art Dealer) to Collectors against Commissions. Each Commision specifies which movement the painting must come from (Renaissance/Mannerism, Baroque/Rococo, Neoclassicism/Romanticism, Impressionism/Symbolism, Cubism/Expressionism, or Surrealism/Contemporary).

Alternatively, the can sell their painting to one of five Museums for less profit but greater increase in reputation.

Finally, they can Exhibit their painting to improve their cashflow and enhance the star-value of their paintings.

Other actions include taking money from Investors; employing an Art Historian to find paintings previosuly discarded; restoring damaged paintings to their full glory; and even forging paintings in the main galleries.

Players are given identical hands of six action cards which they will use to manipulate a stack of two double-sided tokens (through actions such as "flip stack" and "swap tokens"). The stack starts the game in a random sequence.

Each player sets one card aside at the game's start. Then, for each round, each player chooses a card from their hand, both being revealed simultaneously. The uppermost colour on the stack determines which player's action takes effect first. When both cards have been processed, they are discarded and the top colour on the stack determines that round's winner.

The game is played over five rounds, the score for each round being one, one, one, two and three points respectively. If tied, the initially discarded cards are used to play a tiebreaker round.

Don't Get Eated is a social game of survival of the fittest. Players take on the role of animals both working together and against each other to survive in the wilds. Failure meet the challenge presented each round results in a vicious attack, until only one animal remains standing.

In Don't Get Eated, each round will call for players to simultaneously play a numerical card from their hand. Players are attempting to meet a specific challenge stated by that round (e.g. play over a certain number, play under a certain number, etc.). Every player that plays the same numbered card is considered on a team for that round, and their played value is increased by the number of people on the team. Any player or team that does not meet the challenge is wounded, and they are closer to losing the game. Players may be knocked out (or eated) by taking multiple wounds.

link.value: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)

item.description:
Step right up, step right up! The little circuses are open for business!

In Little Circuses, you'll build your big top with attractions that'll wow the crowd. Recruit sword swallowers, daredevils, and mesmerizing mystics in an effort to turn your little road show into a fixture of fun!

item.description:
Black Ops is a skirmish wargame of tactical espionage combat for two or more players. It recreates on the tabletop the tension and excitement of modern action-thrillers such as the Bond and Bourne films, The Unit or Burn Notice TV shows, and the Splinter Cell and Modern Warfare series of video games.

The fast-play rules use regular 6-sided dice and a card-driven activation system to keep all players in the thick of the action, while the mission generator provides a wide range of options for scenarios, from stealthy extraction or surveillance missions to more overt raids or assassinations.

Stealth, combat and technical expertise all have a role to play, and players may select from a number of different character types – spies, mercenaries, criminals, hackers, special forces and many more – to recruit the best possible team for the job.

Players may also choose to join a faction – powerful organizations, intelligence agencies, criminal syndicates, militaries or rebel groups, each with a stake in international affairs. By doing so, their team may receive certain benefits, but may also find itself limited at a crucial time. With the variety offered by the characters, factions and scenarios, no two games of Black Ops should ever be the same!

Although the standard Black Ops setting is an ultra-modern world just a hair removed from our own, the rules are versatile and adaptable enough to suit OSS operations behind Nazi lines, Cold War-era infiltration missions in Moscow or Berlin, or sabotage runs against a rival corporation’s interests in a cyberpunk dystopia, and the rulebook will include a guide to running games in such settings.

Players are drug dealers, hustling on the mean street corners to get enough cash to become above the law. Drug crews must manage many different resources, such as drug packages, money, reputation cards, and wanted level. Real estate is everything, so drug crews have to battle it out over who gets to sling on any given corner.

Street Empire is a worker placement game where each player has three workers, or Crew pawns, to place across any of eight different spaces, or Corners. Acting one at a time, each player places one Crew pawn on one Corner. When all Crew pawns have been placed, if two or more players place their Crew pawns on the same Corner, a turf war breaks out. Players also have a hand of cards, or Rep cards, which are used to win turf wars. Rep cards have a rating and an effect, both of which affect the outcome of a turf war.

All the while, the police are watching. They are keeping an eye on how many drugs the players are selling. When a player gains a Wanted chit, he or she must now pay an additional package or money chit when buying Immunity or selling packages (to pay off the dirty cops).

Players must plan carefully to coordinate their Crew pawns, their Rep cards, drug packages, wanted level, and money to gain just enough of an edge to win. The first player to acquire three Immunity points wins the game. The only way to gain Immunity is through a Corner, which costs money.

link.value: The Game: Drugs and the Street

item.description:
Game covers battle of Mokra, one the first battle of 1939 campaing, fought between polish Volhynian Cavalry Brigade and German 4th Panzer Division. It uses "Battles of The Second World War" system.

Game was published in 40 issue of Taktyka i Strategia magazine in both the Polish and the English edition.
A motorized dexterity game about collecting balls of takoyaki before the timer expires. Can be played either in turns, or simultaneously with scoring based on the contents of the balls.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Kassel

In turns, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Kassel. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

This is a meld-building card game wherein the rules of play are the rules of Japanese syntax. The game has solo, collaborative, and competitive modes. The cards each have a Japanese word printed on them, and are color-coded by part of speech (e.g. all verbs are red).

Each card has a point value, and playing the cards according to a color pattern results in a grammatically correct Japanese sentence that awards the player points equal to the sum of points on cards played. In solo mode, the player tries to reach 20 points in the fewest amount of hands. In collaborative mode, players work together to build and improve sentences until the deck runs out of cards. In competitive mode, the points a player earns on his or her turn ("turn points") allow the player to eliminate cards from opponents' sentences or entire sentences if enough turn points are available.

This deck of Japanese: The Game differs from other decks in vocabulary and art. The vocabulary is in the theme of Japanese folk tales and mythology: sentences like "Momotaro defeated all the Oni on the island" and "The elderly woman healed her companion". This is in contrast with, for example, the Original Core Deck of Japanese: The Game that creates much more general sentences like "My dog will eat the doll" and "Your friend is fun."

link.value: Japanese: The Game – Household Items Expansion
Japanese: The Game – Martial Arts: White Belt Expansion
Japanese: The Game – Weapons and Warfare Expansion

item.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Hilden (city close to Düsseldorf).

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Hilden. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Höxter.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Höxter. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Alfeld.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Alfeld. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

A game where 2-6 players travel through Baden-Wuerttemberg. They get between 9 to 11 city cards, must sort the cards and travel to all their cities in the best order possible. Rolling a 6 means a special acitivity card must be drawn and a detour taken. The last destination to be reached is Stuttgart, the regions capital city. First player to Stuttgart wins the game.
The city cards also contain information about each city such as its characteristics or famous sights found there.

Games from this series are also available for other regions like Hessen-Reise, Sachsen-Reise etc.

name.value: Spheres of Influence: Struggle for Global Supremacy

item.description:
Spheres of Influence: Struggle for Global Supremacy is a 2-8 player free-for-all light wargame, set on a modern world map. Players will take control of one of the games 8 mighty factions as they compete over the world's spheres of influence, capitals and oil reserves. Will a mighty caliphate rise to power? Will the communist curtain once again fall? Or will western democracy sweep the world?

In games with fewer than 5 players, each player will control 1-4 factions simultaneously, coordinating their efforts against the other players' coalitions. Each faction will begin the game with only a single, semi-randomly determined territory under its control. From this one space, factions will aggressively expand.

The gameplay of Spheres of Influence is divided into a set number of rounds, with each round being split into 2 phases: the mobilization phase and the turn phase. During the mobilization phase, factions take turns placing units based on how powerful they are. During this phase, the global turn deck is also formed. This deck will be used to determine the turn order and frequency of action for each faction during the upcoming turn phase. To form it, each faction contributes a number of their turn cards (based on the number of oil fields they control) to a single, shared deck of turn cards. This deck is then shuffled and place down on the table.

During the turn phase, one at a time the top card of the turn deck is revealed. Whichever faction's card was just flipped, that faction takes a turn, performing a single action with its units on a single space (moving, attacking, annexing or passing). Once that action is complete, that turn ends and the next turn card is revealed, with the process repeating itself. This makes turns both fast (with many turns lasting only a couple of seconds) and suspenseful, since none of the factions know precisely when their turns will be. It also ensures more incremental game developments - factions cannot sweep across all of Asia in a single turn and players can respond to attacks or betrayals much sooner. Once the last turn card in the global turn deck has been revealed, a round ends and another round begins.

Combat is resolved by a simple dice mechanic fused with a "situational" modifier that loosely simulates the increased difficulty of attacking a defended coastline, breaking a naval blockade, or striking a fortified position. Along the way, powerful special cards can be played, allowing players to strike with submarines, deploy heavy armor, paradrop troops around enemy defenses, and launch devastating nuclear attacks.

Games have either 5 or 6 rounds depending on the number of factions. Once the final round is complete, the faction who controls the most spheres of influence wins the game for its owner. Games typically last about an hour and a half, and experienced players can sometimes finish in just a single hour.

item.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target spaces with all (3) of your pawns precisely

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; use one die moving forward; ending on a red space: promotion; black space: move backwards. Other pawns can be passed if rolled number allows to jump, otherwise you are blocked. Pawns can't be kicked, a '6' forces you to step out of starting position and let you roll again.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Gifhorn.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Gifhorn. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Objective:
Be the first to reach target space (59)
Typical 'Roll & Move' game similar to Game of Goose.
Very nice drawings/printing and - of course - pewter pawns
